clinical_study.brief_title: Internet-delivered CBT for Adolescents With Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder - a Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Internet-delivered Cognitive Behavior Therapy for Adolescents With Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder - a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main goal of this trial is to study the feasibility and effectiveness of internet-delivered cognitive behavior therapy for adolescents with obsessive-compulsive disorder.

primary_outcome.measure: Children's Yale Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale, CY-BOCS
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline of obsessions and compulsions after 12 weeks and at 3- and 6 months after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Spence Child Anxiety Scale - Child and Parent version
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
secondary_outcome.description: Spence Child Anxiety Scale - Child and Parent version (SCAS/P, Spence, 1998) will be used as a child and parent self-report measure of anxiety related psychopathology.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom severity of depression in the adolescent will be assessed with Child Depression Inventory (CDI, Kovacs, 1985).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
secondary_outcome.description: Strengths Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ, Goodman, 1997) is a widely used self- and parent-report behavioral screening questionnaire with six subscales: emotional problems, conduct problems, hyperactivity-inattention, peer problems, prosocial behavior

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
secondary_outcome.description: The Children's Obsessional Compulsive Inventory Revised, (CHOCI-R, Shafran et al., 2003) is a self- and parent-report measure of pediatric OCD symptom severity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
secondary_outcome.description: Child Obsessive-Compulsive Impact Scale - Revised (COIS-R, Piacentini, Peris, Bergman, Chang, & Jaffer, 2007) is a self- and parent-report scale of OCD symptom impact on everyday life.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
other_outcome.description: Patient Health Questionnaire PHQ-9 (Kroenke, Spitzer, & Williams, 2001) is a brief self-report measure of depressive symptoms in adults. PHQ-9 will be used to measure parental depressive symptoms.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
other_outcome.description: GAD-7 (Spitzer, Kroenke, Williams, & Löwe, 2006) is a brief self-report measure of symptoms of general anxiety in adults. GAD-7 will be used to measure symptoms of anxiety in the parents.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
other_outcome.description: Obsessive Compulsive Inventory - Revised (OCI-R, Foa et al., 2002) is a reliable and valid 18-item self-report scale for screening of OCD in adults and will be used to measure parental OC symptoms of both parents.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 weeks after treatment starts, 3 and 6 months after treatment has ended
other_outcome.description: Family Accommodation Scale, Parent-Report (FAS-PR, Flessner et al., 2009). The parent-report version of the FAS consists of 12 items focusing on accommodation behaviors of parents with a child with OCD.

arm_group.description: Participants will be assigned to a 12 weeks internet-delivered cognitive behavior therapy program including therapist contact via an internet platform and telephone.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- a primary diagnosis of OCD as defined by DSM-IV TR
- a total score of above 15 on the CY-BOCS
- age between 12 and 17 years
- ability to read and write Swedish
- daily access to the internet
- a parent that is able to co-participate in the treatment
- Participants on psychotropic medication must have been on a stable dose for the last 6 weeks prior to baseline assessment
- signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed autism spectrum disorder, psychosis or bipolar disorder
- suicidal ideation
- ongoing substance dependence
- subject not able to read or understand the basics of the ICBT self-help material
- completed CBT for OCD within last 12 months (defined as at least 5 sessions CBT including exposure and response prevention)
- ongoing psychological treatment for OCD or another anxiety disorder
